clinical_study.brief_title: 2D-radiotherapy in Palliation of Advanced Esophageal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Short-course Accelerated 2D-radiotherapy in Palliative Treatment of Advanced Esophageal Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi

brief_summary.textblock: The study wants to define the efficacy of a short course 2D-radiation therapy in patients with symptomatic advanced esophageal cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: The study wants to define the efficacy of a short course accelerated 2D-radiation therapy delivered in twice daily fractions and 2 consecutive days for symptomatic palliation of advanced esophageal cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of symptoms [odynophagia, chest-back pain, dysphagia, regurgitation]
primary_outcome.description: Symptoms were graded using the IAEA scoring system. Values range from 0 (no symptom) to 4 (severe symptom).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Acute radiation toxicity]
secondary_outcome.description: Acute toxicity after treatment is evaluated with the Radiation Therapy Oncology Group (RTOG) scale. Values range from 0 (no acute toxicity) to 4 (maximum acute toxicity).
Performance Status after the treatment is evaluated according with the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) score. Values range from 0 (better status) to 5 (worst status).
Overall Survival is evaluated from the end of radiotherapy to the last date of follow-up. It is calculated in months.

arm_group.description: The radiotherapy is delivered over 2 days with accelerated hypo-fractionation and 2D-technique.

intervention.description: An accelerated hypo-fractionation 2D-radiotherapy is delivered for palliation in patients with advanced esophageal cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- histologically proven advanced esophageal cancer
- excluded from curative therapy because of disease stage and/or presence of multiple comorbidities and/or poor performance status
- age > 18 years
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) <3
Exclusion Criteria:
- prior radiotherapy to the same region
